intro: Herpetophytum disoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a small herbaceous perennial, often forming a rosette of leaves. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
